  • Method Details

    • peek

      public String peek()
      Peek at the token in current position and return it without changing the position
      Returns:
      returns the Token at the current position, null if there are no more tokens

    • next

      public String next()
      Retrieves the token in current position and increments the position by 1
      Returns:
      returns the Token at the current position, null if there are no more tokens

    • read_str

      public static Types.MyDataType read_str​(String input) throws InterpreterErrors.SyntaxError, InterpreterErrors.EmptyLineError, InterpreterErrors.CommentError, InterpreterErrors.ParenMismatchError, InterpreterErrors.ParseError
      Takes a string and returns the corresponding S-expression. It first splits the input string into tokens and then converts them into the internal datatypes.
      Parameters:
      input - string of an s-expression
      Returns:
      S-expression of the input string in the proper datatypes
      Throws:
      InterpreterErrors.SyntaxError
      InterpreterErrors.EmptyLineError - Lets the main loop ignore empty lines
      InterpreterErrors.CommentError
      InterpreterErrors.ParenMismatchError
      InterpreterErrors.ParseError

    • tokenize

      public static ArrayList<String> tokenize​(String input) throws InterpreterErrors.SyntaxError, InterpreterErrors.CommentError
      Takes the input read from the user as one string and splits it into the tokens that make up the input, e.g. (+ 2 (- 1 2)) will return the tokens [+, 2, (- 1 2)]
      Parameters:
      input - Some string that represents some sort of (partial) expression
      Returns:
      List of tokens
      Throws:
      InterpreterErrors.SyntaxError - when it attempts to tokenize an empty String or a non-closed String.
      InterpreterErrors.CommentError - if there is a comment at the start of a line it tells the main loop to ignore this line completely

    • readForm

      public static Types.MyDataType readForm​(Reader reader) throws InterpreterErrors.ParseError, InterpreterErrors.ParenMismatchError
      Peek at token and depending on 1st char of that token call either: -readList() if its a left parenthesis -readAtom() otherwise or substitute the shorthand quote symbol ' with parenthesis quote syntax
      Parameters:
      reader - Reader object holding the tokens
      Returns:
      either a ListType or an atom (Integer, Symbol or String)
      Throws:
      InterpreterErrors.ParseError - if there is some internal error and we attempt to read a null token. This happens when one of the delegate methods (readList or readAtom) doesnt check for null values properly
      InterpreterErrors.ParenMismatchError

    • readList

      public static Types.MyDataType readList​(Reader reader) throws InterpreterErrors.ParenMismatchError, InterpreterErrors.ParseError
      Throws:
      InterpreterErrors.ParenMismatchError
      InterpreterErrors.ParseError

    • readAtom

      public static Types.MyDataType readAtom​(Reader reader) throws InterpreterErrors.ParseError
      Converts an atom from its string representation to an internal datatype. Does not treat empty list as a datatype
      Parameters:
      reader - the reader object holding the tokens
      Returns:
      MyDataType representing the token
      Throws:
      InterpreterErrors.ParseError - if the token is null or doesnt match any datatype
